author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Please add
```
[compat]
julia = "1"
```
to your project file and retrigger the bot.

Also, what does the acronym stand for? Is it some kind of domain specific thing? All I get from searching is http://www.srcwa.asn.au/ which I guess is unrelated. Maybe you can find a more descriptive name? See https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1

> Scatter-matrix Rigorously Coupled Wave Analysis

That's a pretty long repo name...

> > Scatter-matrix Rigorously Coupled Wave Analysis
> 
> That's a pretty long repo name...

Indeed, and that is my problem when naming this and making up that acronym. I could just call it RCWA (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rigorous_coupled-wave_analysis) which is the commonly used acronym, but it is not specific enough to describe the particular subtype implemented here. I think the better option for me is to go with ScatterRCWA.jl
I think SRCWA is a fine name. We've significantly relaxed the no acronyms thing since name collisions are no longer such a big deal.

Please add
```
[compat]
julia = "1"
```
to your project file and retrigger the bot.
